QUESTION 126) One of the strategies for food conservation is SALTURE, addition of sodium chloride (NaCl), historically used by drovers, cowboys and backcountry to conserve ox, pig and fish.
What happens to the cells present in the preserved foods with this technique?
A) The added salt decreases the concentration of solutes inside.
B) the added salt disorganizes and destroys its plasma membranes.
C) The addition of salt alters the properties of its plasma membranes.
D) Na+ and Clâˆ’ ions from salt dissociation enter them freely.
E) The large concentration of salt in the extracellular medium causes water to exit from them.
